intro: Agalinis erecta, commonly known as the upright false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Agalinis erecta is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is known for its ability to thrive in full sun.
